item.title: NPR reports from Texas' Kerr County, which saw the worst flooding
item.description: Kerr County, Texas, experienced the worst of the flooding and has seen the highest death toll. NPR's Juana Summers describes the scene where she arrived Monday morning.

item.title: DHS ends Temporary Protected Status for thousands from Nicaragua and Honduras
item.description: Some 76,000 people from Nicaragua and Honduras were covered by TPS, which provides protection from deportation and grants work permits to people from certain nations affected by war or natural disasters.

item.title: BRICS nations push back as Trump warns of tariffs
item.description: Leaders of the BRICS group of emerging economies meeting for their annual summit had hoped to downplay any differences with the U.S. But even a toned down group proclamation drew the ire of President Trump.

item.title: DOJ says no evidence Jeffrey Epstein had a 'client list' or blackmailed associates
item.description: The two-page memo outlines the "exhaustive review" the department conducted of the Epstein files in its possession, and also reiterates that Epstein died by suicide, contrary to some conspiracy theories.

item.title: Floods are getting more dangerous around the country, not just in Texas
item.description: The deadly floods in Central Texas were caused by extremely heavy rain. Climate change is causing even more rain to fall during the heaviest storms.

item.title: Can't sleep? Journalist Jennifer Senior says you're not alone in your insomnia
item.description: Pulitzer Prize-winning writer Jennifer Senior has had insomnia for 25 years. Her new piece in The Atlantic is about her often futile attempts to fall asleep, and about the latest research into insomnia.

item.title: Near old Montana mine, special clinic for asbestos-related illness fights to survive
item.description: The Center for Asbestos Related Disease in Libby, Montana, closed in May after a court judgment. The clinic's federal funding is also threatened. Patients with scarred lungs worry about what's next.
